programme.title: Recita del Rosario
programme.sub-title: Dalla basilica papale di Santa Maria Maggiore in Roma
programme.desc: Dalla cappella della 'Salus Populi Romani', la preghiera dei misteri da parte del clero locale.

programme.title: Sulla strada
programme.desc: Sulle strade del mondo e della vita accompagnati dalla parola del Vangelo. L'analisi del Vangelo è illustrata da immagini animate che ci riportano la storia e l'ambiente in cui Gesù viveva.

programme.title: I Santi
programme.desc: Riccardo Pampuri è stato un religioso e medico italiano dell'Ordine Ospedaliero di San Giovanni. A novembre del 1989, fu proclamato santo da Papa Giovanni Paolo II.

programme.title: Il canto gregoriano
programme.desc: Il cosiddetto canto gregoriano è stato scelto ai primi del novecento come modello assoluto di musica da chiesa. La monodia liturgica ha, infatti, lunghe tradizioni nella storia del cristianesimo.

programme.title: I Santi
programme.desc: Un documentario dedicato a Carlo Borromeo, cardinale e arcivescovo venerato come santo dalla Chiesa cattolica, canonizzato nel 1610 da papa Paolo V a soli 26 anni dalla morte.

programme.title: Borghi d'Italia
programme.desc: Casa natale Santa Maria de Mattias, Muretti a secco patrimonio dell' Unesco.

programme.title: Quel che bolle in pentola
programme.desc: Cuciniamo gnocchi rossi all'italiana, spaghetti con le telline e orata al guazzetto.

programme.title: Borghi d'Italia
programme.desc: Un viaggio sul territorio con lo sguardo rivolto alle persone, all'ambiente, al paesaggio al folklore. I borghi italiani visti come comunità e traino semplice, ma forte, di un intero territorio; il tutto dal vivo.

programme.title: Recita del Rosario
programme.desc: L'appuntamento con la riflessione, la meditazione e la recita dei misteri del rosario.

programme.title: I Santi
programme.sub-title: Santa Teresina del bambin Gesù di Lisieux
programme.desc: Suor Teresa di Gesù Bambino e del Volto Santo, detta di Lisieux, fu beatificata il 29 aprile 1923 da papa Pio XI, e proclamata santa dallo stesso papa il 17 maggio 1925.

programme.title: Preghiera del mattino
programme.desc: Un momento collettivo di riflessione e spiritualità, che va dal Credo al Padre Nostro.

programme.title: Terra Santa News
programme.desc: Il Franciscan Media Center propone tutte le settimane, da Gerusalemme, un notiziario che racconta la Terra Santa tra fede, storia, e attualità per svelare tutta la ricchezza di questa terra di Dio, così spesso dimenticata.

programme.title: Borghi d'Italia
programme.desc: Scopriamo il comune di Montaquila, in Molise. Nel corso del programma intervengono il sindaco, il parroco e gli altri protagonisti della vita cittadina, che descrivono il loro paese attraverso i borghi, le chiese e lo storico fiume Volturno.

programme.title: Recita del Rosario
programme.desc: L'appuntamento con la riflessione, la meditazione e la recita dei misteri del rosario.

programme.title: Retroscena
programme.desc: Serie di reportage che vogliono testimoniare la forma e la sostanza del teatro oggi, con le sue espressioni, i suoi mutamenti, i suoi scenari e le sue tendenze.

programme.title: Sulla strada

programme.title: Santa Messa
programme.desc: In diretta dalla Basilica di San Pietro in Vaticano, la Santa Messa celebrata dal Sua Santità, Papa Francesco.

programme.title: Buongiorno Professore
programme.desc: Le lezioni del professor Andrea Monda,insegnante di religione cattolica presso il liceo classico Pilo Albertelli nel centro di Roma.

programme.title: Il diario di Papa Francesco
programme.desc: Gli impegni e le iniziative del Santo Padre: udienze, documenti, incontri, discorsi, omelie e gesti. Seguiamolo passo dopo passo, con inviati, servizi, interviste e dirette.

programme.title: Viaggio Apostolico del Santo Padre ad Ajaccio
programme.desc: Dal Palais des Congrès et d'Exposition d'Ajaccio, Sua Santità Papa Francesco I presiede la sessione conclusiva del congresso "La Religiosité Populaire en Méditerranée", in cui tiene un discorso.

programme.title: Il diario di Papa Francesco
programme.desc: Gli impegni e le iniziative del Santo Padre: udienze, documenti, incontri, discorsi, omelie e gesti. Seguiamolo passo dopo passo, con inviati, servizi, interviste e dirette.

programme.title: Viaggio Apostolico del Santo Padre ad Ajaccio
programme.desc: Sua Santità Papa Francesco I recita la preghiera dell'Angelus con i vescovi, i sacerdoti, i diaconi, i consacrati e le consacrate e i seminaristi nella Cattedrale di Santa Maria Assunta.

programme.title: Il diario di Papa Francesco
programme.desc: Gli impegni e le iniziative del Santo Padre: udienze, documenti, incontri, discorsi, omelie e gesti. Seguiamolo passo dopo passo, con inviati, servizi, interviste e dirette.

programme.title: Borghi d'Italia
programme.desc: In provincia di Belluno, in un territorio lungo la valle del Piave, si trova Longarone, un comune incluso nel parco nazionale delle Dolomiti Bellunesi, noto per l'immane tragedia che lo ha investito.

programme.title: Mr. Magorium e la bottega delle meraviglie
programme.desc: Quando l'eccentrico proprietario di un magico negozio di giocattoli decide di lasciare spazio al suo assistente, le cose cambiano.

programme.title: Coroncina alla Divina Misericordia
programme.desc: Seguiamo insieme la recita della preghiera devozionale, ideata nel 1935 da suor Faustina Kowalska. I versi sono ispirati dalla visione di un angelo di cui la santa fu testimone durante la sua vita.

programme.title: Soul
programme.desc: In ogni puntata un personaggio pubblico si racconta, aprendo una finestra sulla propria anima e sulla propria umanità. Lo fa parlandoci delle proprie radici, della propria storia, del rapporto con la religione e non solo.

programme.title: The Water Diviner
programme.desc: Quattro anni dopo la Battaglia di Gallipoli, l'agricoltore australiano Joshua Connor si reca in Turchia alla ricerca dei tre figli dispersi in guerra. Una volta giunto a Istanbul inizia un viaggio attraverso il paese per scoprire la verità.

programme.title: Guai con gli angeli
programme.desc: Le vicende quotidiane di due ragazze adolescenti in un collegio cattolico. Vivaci e irrequiete, ne combinano di tutti i colori. Una delle amiche inizia a diventare una studentessa seria quando la Madre Superiora decide di non espellerla.

programme.title: Effetto notte
programme.desc: Il cinema è un flusso, si alimenta delle sue storie, dei suoi volti, ieri come oggi. Effetto notte torna in versione rinnovata, e guida gli spettatori in un originale ma elementare percorso attraverso il cinema di ieri, di oggi e di domani.

programme.title: Angelus
programme.desc: Il pontefice celebra il rito per i fedeli di tutto il mondo cristiano cattolico.

programme.desc: Le monache agostiniane del convento dei Santi Quattro Coronati in Roma recitano la compieta, preghiera della sera che comprende un salmo, una breve lettura e il cantico di Zaccaria.

programme.title: I Santi
programme.desc: Un documentario dedicato a San Giovanni Bosco, fondatore delle congregazioni dei Salesiani e delle Figlie di Maria Ausiliatrice. È stato canonizzato da papa Pio XI nel 1934.

programme.title: Pinturicchio
programme.desc: Documentario dedicato a Bernardino di Benedetto di Biagio, passato alla storia come il Pinturicchio, nato a Perugia tra il 1456 e il 1460 da una modesta famiglia di artigiani residente nel rione di Porta Sant' Angelo.

programme.title: Alien From Area 51: The Alien Autopsy Footage Revealed
programme.desc: There has been thousands of UFO photos and hours of video footage submitted to UFO researchers in the last 50 years, but by far the most controversial is the Alien Autopsy Footage. London businessman Ray Santilli, originally launched the footage on the TV viewing public in August 1995. Santilli claimed it showed the autopsy of a dead alien recovered from a crashed flying saucer found near Roswell, New Mexico in 1947. The body was then moved to Hanger 18 at the infamous Area 51 also known as \"Dreamland.\" Until now, no one has known the real facts behind the \"Alien Autopsy Footage.\" For over fifteen years the creators of the infamous film have remained silent. Warner Bros. made a hit feature film and the world wanted to know more. Now Ray Santilli and Gary Shoefield reveal all, including the truth about sinister Men in Black invading their lives; how the Chinese knew about the original footage; their beliefs in alien visitation to planet Earth; how governments around the globe are dealing with the phenomenon; and the genetic manipulation of human kind. An unprecedented perspective on the UFO enigma and what it means for us all, \"Alien from Area 51\" will test your beliefs and rattle you to the core. See the entire \"Alien Autopsy Footage,\" unedited and uncensored. The time is coming for alien intervention on planet Earth whether we are ready or not.

They replace those we've lost with clones and devise technology that helps us live out our greatest fantasies; from saving a failed relationship, to creating the perfect lover, to being irresistible to the opposite sex - but sometimes our deepest desires come at a terrible price. 4Ever offers customers the opportunity to live out their fantasies in a virtual world but there are secrets within 4Ever Innovations that may cost you your life.

programme.title: World Mysteries - Pearl Harbor: Surprise Attack or Anticipated Event?
programme.desc: December 7, 1941: The Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, Hawaii devastates the U.S. Pacific Fleet and pushes America into World War II. . The history books fail to explain if the surprise attack was really a surprise. This program addresses that question.

programme.title: Flights Over Area 51: American Experiments or Alien Aircraft?
programme.desc: This special interviews a man, who, as a teenage science prodigy, was allowed into the Area 51 base. He relates an amazing account of science and engineering far advanced from any known on earth. What is really flying over Area 51.

programme.title: FELL: Relationships Can Bring You Down
programme.desc: Bill has problems. He lost his job, he quit the band, his medications are running out, and his relationship with his ex-girlfriend, Jenny, has gone down the drain. And now he has a new problem. Bill has a dead girl in his bathtub, and he can't remember how she got there. Bill's best friend, Derrek, is the only person he feels he can trust. Now their next step is to figure out who she was and what to do with her decomposing body. Relationships can bring you down.

programme.title: Asteroid Collision: Doomsday Destruction or Passing Apprehension?
programme.desc: There are over 31,000 known meteor impact sites on Earth with craters up to 186 miles in diameter. Some experts say an impact doomsday scenario is science fiction. Others say it is only a question of when . Could humanity survive? Could Earth survive.

programme.title: Crop Signs: Off-World Warnings or Technological Tampering?
programme.desc: There have been 9,000 crop circle sightings in the last 30 years globally. Are these increasingly complex designs the result of microwave emissions? Communication from extraterrestrials? A simple hoax? This program examines the possibilities.

programme.title: Egyptian Pyramids: Architectural Wonder or Alien Engineering?
programme.desc: The Pyramids of Egypt are among the largest structures ever built. Archeologists and researchers have determined ancient Egypt lacked the tools and skills required to build the pyramids. So how did the Egyptians build them over four thousand years ago.

programme.title: World Mysteries - American POWs and MIAs: Dead or Imprisoned?
programme.desc: Official U.S. government policy is that there is no credible evidence that any POWs or those listed as MIA are still alive from World War II, the Korean War or the Vietnam War. Is that a true fact? What is the truth about the fate of our POWs and MIAs.

programme.title: The Defiled: We Are All Meat
programme.desc: In a post apocalyptic world, science and technology have backfired leaving unfathomable destruction and a permanently diseased planet in its wake. A virus is mutating the human race turning innocent survivors into mindless cannibals. In a savage future world devoid of hope, a man infected with the deadly viral disease must cope with the burden of a new born son, ensuring his survival. Though he is infected, he does not allow his growing desire for human flesh to overcome his responsibility to the newborn. Along the road, traveling from town to town, he saves an unaffected woman from a certain death by facing down her perpetrators. Ultimately she joins him on his odyssey, a journey through hell on earth in search of a safe haven in which they can perhaps start a life together, both becoming committed to doing whatever it takes to make sure the child survives. Reminiscent of the work of Lynch, Maddin and Tarkovsky, The Defiled is a black and white epic of unparalleled artistry examining life, death and the ultimate sacrifice of love. Not since Carnival of Souls and Night of the Living Dead has a film captured the surreal outer dimensions of the human condition.

programme.title: Max Reload and the Nether Blasters
programme.desc: A small town video game store clerk must go from zero to hero after accidentally unleashing the forces of evil from a cursed Colecovision video game cartridge.

programme.title: Dead Walkers: Rise of the Fourth Reich
programme.desc: Reports of a growing terrorist threat in Romania lead the British Secret Service to send in some of their best men, but nobody returns from the field. In a final attempt to get through, Alpha One and Alpha Five are dispatched to try and uncover the truth. What they discover is a bizarre scientific and occult training ground of neo-Nazis descendants of Nazis who fled following their defeat in the Second World War. Over the years they have been researching the energy they call VRIL and utilizing it to grow an army of men and women who cannot be killed, because they're already dead. Attempting to stay under cover and out of sight, Alpha One and Alpha Five come face to face with the terror of the Nazi VRIL soldiers and witness shocking tortures and beatings used to energize the human soul. Mentally twisted, the leaders of this Nazi group are bent on taking over the world with their new VRIL army and bring about the rise of the 4th Reich.

programme.title: Fast Zombies with Guns
programme.desc: Collateral Damage. Sometimes, it s unavoidable. Mobster Kingpin Paul Varlo s (Charles Ramsey) attempt to kill a potential rat by poisoning his personal water supply leads to something he never saw coming an outbreak of zombie carnage! To make matters worse, these zombies are different; they re faster, meaner and they re armed With the town being overrun by fast zombies with guns, one resilient band of people are left to attempt an escape to the nearest undead-free zone and survival.Meanwhile, Jake (Tony Swansey) and his girlfriend Laura (Leena Kurishingal) are cruising their way up to this sweet, little Midwestern town. One quick business transaction with the local mob boss, and they can continue on their way to some fun in the sun, as planned. However, what they discover is a deserted town at first.Will the group survive the terror that has befallen them? Will Jake and Laura get their money?? Will the zombies run out of bullets??? The answers can be found in Fast Zombies with Guns.

programme.title: Melvin
programme.desc: MELVIN is dead... Now, three years after his accidental murder, he is finally making up for lost time. After enlisting the involuntary help of nerdy college student Norton Pincus, he's ready to take on those who are responsible for his death. Melvin's thirst for vengeance will take this dynamic dork duo on a mind-blowing streak of throat ripping, vomit spewing, head decapitating and much, much more. Featuring a cameo by Troma Entertainment's Lloyd Kaufman (The Toxic Avenger, Poultrygeist) and songs from The Sawyer Family, Monday With a Bullet and Double Plus Good. Melvin will teach you that getting picked on at school can be a real killer.

programme.title: Zombie Massacre: Army of the Dead
programme.desc: An evil and corrupt U.S. government agency accidentally unleashes a virus on a small town while attempting to perfect a top-secret biological weapon designed to create the perfect army. The experiment goes horrificly wrong, when the advanced biological weapon transforms the residents of a sleepy Maryland town into ravenous flesh-eating Monsters - Zombies so bloodthirsty for human flesh that nothing can stop the carnage. A handful of citizens who have remained uninfected seek sanctuary in a local movie theater, holed up together preparing to make a last stand against the undead. This gore-soaked shocker is not for the squeamish, Zombie Massacre: Army of the Dead will rattle you to your core.

programme.title: The Bisbee Cannibal Club
programme.desc: Vegetarians are disappearing from the little town of Bisbee, AZ. When a group of locals discover that their secret hallucinatory cactus garden has been used as a human barbecue and burial site, the existence of the Bisbee Cannibal Club becomes horrifyingly apparent. They form a vigilante gang, calling themselves The Bisbee Cannibal Hunters, to avenge their garden, save a vegetarian or two from being eaten and try to survive the Cannibal attack from the legions of flesh eaters now running amok. Bonus Features includes the award winning short A Road Kill Cautionary Tale.

programme.title: Fast Zombies with Guns

programme.title: Tales of the Dead: Grim Stories of Curses, Horror and Gore
programme.desc: Five friends gather on Halloween to continue their ritual of telling horror stories. Each one telling a more sinister tale than the next, unaware of the horror that awaits them on this all Hallows eve. A film from award winning director Kemal Yildirim. Less is More: May Walker suffers from a disorder known as BIID (Body Integrity Identity Disorder). She has a constant desire to be an amputee to feel complete. She struggles to cope until one day when a mysterious doctor makes her an offer that s impossible to refuse. (Awarded top 10 in the Zone Horror competition and shown at Fright Fest) Wolf Cry: Zack is a slacking teenager who is obsessed with horror movies to the point where nothing else matters. His constant daydreaming derails his life until one night he experiences something that profoundly changes his world forever. Penance: The city is in the grip of a sadist serial killer. Detective Klein is a recovering alcoholic whose career is in tatters until he is chosen by the serial killer to play a horrifying game of cat and mouse. Missing: Five friends investigating an ancient curse on Cromwell Street in England discover far more than they bargained for when they unknowingly unleash a dark force that has been lying dormant for centuries. Includes Special Features.

programme.title: Terror In Woods Creek
programme.desc: In the small town of Woods Creek, terror arrived in 1962 in the form of a mysterious Drifter. A chain of bizarre events & murder ensued then the Drifter left. Now, 50 years later, he has returned.

programme.title: The Jurassic Dead
programme.desc: A unit of mercenaries must team up with a group of tech-geek students after America is struck with an EMP attack. Deep in the desert, they find the source of the terror, a mad scientist.

programme.title: Darkslide
programme.desc: Five best friends, all extreme skateboarders, set out on a road trip to find one of their missing brothers. Their adventure quickly turns into an epic battle for survival.

programme.title: World Mysteries - American POWs and MIAs: Dead or Imprisoned?

programme.title: September 11th: Mayhem or Miracles?
programme.desc: The September 11, 2001 attacks impacted American society like no event since Pearl Harbor. This program examines the heroes who emerged amidst the horror of 9-11 and shows the selflessness of everyday men and women under the most adverse conditions.

programme.title: Area 51 Base: Experimental Aircraft or Extraterrestrial Evidence?
programme.desc: The U.S. Government says Area 51 is just an Air Force operating location . Planes are warned they'll be shot down if they fly over. Signs authorizing deadly force surround the base. Helicopters and Humvees are on constant patrol. What are they guarding.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: A special agent from Chicago is sent out west to bring in the notorious Reno brothers.

programme.title: The Phantom Planet
programme.desc: Astronaut drawn to asteroid and miniaturized by atmosphere.

programme.title: Inner Sanctum
programme.desc: Murderer hides out in boarding house in small town.

programme.title: The Red House
programme.desc: Old man conceals dark secret from adopted teen daughter.

programme.title: Salt of the Earth
programme.desc: Mexican workers at a Zinc mine call a general strike.

programme.title: The Hoodlum
programme.desc: Sociopath criminal masterminds armored car robbery.

programme.title: The Sadist
programme.desc: Three people driving into Los Angeles for a Dodgers game have car trouble and pull off into an old wrecking yard where they are held at bay by a bloodthirsty psycho and his crazy girlfriend.

programme.title: Sherlock – Woman in Green
programme.desc: Murdered young women have finger severed off.

programme.title: War Comes to America
programme.desc: Part VIII of the \"Why We Fight\" series of wartime documentaries. This entry attempts to describe the factors leading up to Americas entry into the Second World War, and shows how the pattern of the Axis powerss aggression turned the American people against isolationism.

programme.title: The Fog Island
programme.desc: A man invites a group of people to a holiday in his island home, intending to exact revenge on them.

programme.title: Tulsa
programme.desc: Woman oil-catter obsessed with wealth in power in Tulsa.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Meets a Brooklyn Gorilla
programme.desc: Two goofy entertainers meet a mad scientist on a jungle island.

programme.title: Planet Outlaws
programme.desc: A 20th Century pilot named Buck Rogers and his young friend Buddy Wade awake from 500 years in suspended animation to find that the world has been taken over by the outlaw army of Killer Kane.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: A sheriff tries to stop homesteader conflicts in the West after the Civil War.

programme.title: Bride of the Gorilla
programme.desc: The owner of a plantation in the jungle marries a beautiful woman. Shortly afterward, he is plagued by a strange voodoo curse which transforms him into a gorilla.

programme.title: The Cummington Story
programme.desc: War refugees begin new lives in a small Massachusetts town.

programme.title: Hollow Triumph
programme.desc: Pursued by the big-time gambler he robbed, John Muller takes a new identity, with ironic results.

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: Secret Service agents make a deal with a counterfeiting inmate to be released on early parole if he will help them recover some bogus moneymaking plates, but he plans to double cross them.

programme.title: Thunderbolt
programme.desc: A WW2 documentary on the P-47 Thunderbolt fighter\/bomber pilots in missions (Operation Strangle) from their base in Corsica to Northern Italy in 1944, destroying railroads, bridges, trains, vehicles and hard targets.

programme.title: Sherlock – Woman in Green
programme.desc: Murdered young women have finger severed off.

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Deadly overnight party in a haunted house.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls
programme.desc: Drowned woman wanders nether-life.

programme.title: Outpost in Morocco
programme.desc: After escorting an Emirs daughter to her fathers stronghold, French Foreign Legion Captain Gerards unit joins an isolated Moroccan outpost facing imminent attack by rebel Bedouin tribes.

programme.title: Shoot to Kill
programme.desc: Woman marries corrupt deputy DA to get evidence of murder frame.

programme.title: Beneath the 12-Mile Reef
programme.desc: Fierce competition among sponge fishermen forces a Greek-American family to fish in the dangerous 12-mile reef area off the western coast of Florida.

programme.title: Bloodlust!
programme.desc: A crazed hunter kidnaps people and turns them loose on his private estate, where he hunts them for sport.

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: Romance and suspense ensue in Paris as a woman is pursued by several men who want a fortune her murdered husband had stolen. Who can she trust.

programme.title: Fear in the Night
programme.desc: Man dreams he committed murder. Was it real.

programme.title: The Battle of San Pietro
programme.desc: Director John Huston documents the Battle of San Pietro - a small town in Italy that blocked the way for the Allied forces from the Germans.

programme.title: High School Caesar
programme.desc: Matt Stevens is the big man at high school. He sweats the students for protection money, acquires copies of tests for a fee, and has rigged the votes so he can beat Kelly in the election ..

programme.title: Murder Once Removed
programme.desc: A doctor and the wife of one of his wealthy patients hatch a plot to get rid of her husband so they can be together and get his money.

programme.title: Journey of Lion
programme.desc: Brother Howie is a Jamaican Rastafari who dreams of the land of his ancestors: Africa. On a journey in search of his roots and his identity he travels through three continents and (with great humor and sensitivity) discovers the world and Africa.

programme.title: FOUR POINTS
programme.desc: Four average citizens have been selected by the newly elected tech-genius President of the United States to participate in a game.

programme.title: Malcolm X: AN OVERWHELMING INFLUENCE ON THE BLACK POWER MOVEMENT
programme.desc: This documentary will give viewers new insight into how Malcolm X changed America through revolutionary ideas, actions, and strategies: ideas that are still relevant and playing out in today's world. Concurrently, viewers get to know Malcolm X, the man, through personal accounts with friends, co-workers and family members along with engaging photos and footage.

programme.title: ROOT UP
programme.desc: Joselie lives in Guadeloupe, F.W.I. When she inherits 5 acres of land from her late father, the former seamstress becomes a farmer at age 48.

programme.title: BURKINABE RISING
programme.desc: Burkinab Rising showcases creative nonviolent resistance in Burkina Faso. A small, landlocked country in West Africa, Burkina Faso is home to a vibrant community of artists and engaged citizens, who provide an example of the type of political change that can be achieved when people come together.

programme.title: AN UNCOMMON WOMAN
programme.desc: Mina is tired of her husband's infidelity and decides to take a drastic decision: She takes a second husband. Based on his conversations with women involved in polygamist relationships, filmmaker Abdoulaye Dao illustrates - to very funny effects - the daily life of two persons - in this case two men - who share a spouse.

programme.title: A LOVER'S CALL
programme.desc: Assim is torn between his faith and a growing bond with poet Kala when he realizes she isn't Muslim.

programme.title: Pahokee - Skip Day
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: La Source
programme.desc: Narrated by Oscar-nominated actor Don Cheadle (Hotel Rwanda, Crash), La Source tells the uplifting story of Josue Lajuenesse, a Haitian Princeton janitor who returns to his country after the devastating 2010 earthquake to revive his lifelong dream to bring what is most fundamental to his village's survival; clean water.

programme.title: TITLE VII
programme.desc: The CEO of Sanger International, an IT consulting firm, is powerful and successful Hillary Kelsey. Kelsey is a black woman with no black employees and no one can figure out why until Darryl Montgomery, her 9:30 am interview, enters the firm.

programme.title: Pahokee - The Send Off
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: FIRST DATE
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: The Brink
programme.desc: The Brink centers around two stranded survivors in an endless wasteland who clash as they unravel the truth of what led them there.

programme.title: Pahokee - The Rabbit Hunt
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: Jazree's Court
programme.desc: Jazree's father was sent to jail for 7 years due to possession of an unloaded firearm. Jazree, who was close to her father, talks about the implication of growing up with him behind bars. Putting a person in jail doesn't just affect that individual it affects their entire family and community.

programme.title: The Jackie Robinson
programme.desc: After a successful baseball career in college and as a coach in the military, Jackie Robinson (playing himself) attracts the attention of Major League Baseball's Branch Rickey (Minor Watson). Rickey wants Robinson to play in the minor leagues, believing he can become the first player to break the color barrier and play in the majors. The only catch: He is forbidden from defending himself against racial bigotry. Supported by his wife (Ruby Dee), Robinson is steadfast in his determination to win.

programme.title: COMPANY TOWN
programme.desc: One man goes up against one of the nation's largest paper mill and chemical plants, owned by billionaire brothers Charles Koch and David Koch of Koch Industries, in a bid to save his town from sickness-causing pollution.

programme.title: AN UNCOMMON WOMAN
programme.desc: Mina is tired of her husband's infidelity and decides to take a drastic decision: She takes a second husband. Based on his conversations with women involved in polygamist relationships, filmmaker Abdoulaye Dao illustrates - to very funny effects - the daily life of two persons - in this case two men - who share a spouse.

programme.title: ANGELA
programme.desc: A Cuban immigrant tries to find her place in New York City.

programme.title: The Whole Gritty City
programme.desc: The documentary follows kids in three bands as the directors get them ready to perform in the Mardi Gras parades, and teach them to succeed and to survive. Through moments of setback, loss, discovery, and triumph, these children and their adult leaders reveal the power and resilience of a culture.

programme.title: FOR THE CAUSE
programme.desc: Mirai Scott, a civil rights attorney in Chicago, defends her estranged father, a former Black Panther, against a 30-year-old attempted murder charge. Long-held hostilities and accusations explode as Mirai aggressively pursues her father s defense.

programme.title: LITTLE MUSIC MANCHILD: THE STORY OF MALIK KOFI
programme.desc: The story follows an 11-year old African American Birmingham native, child prodigy who plays the cello.

programme.desc: When a down on her luck aspiring writer runs out of money after moving to Paris, she meets a street-smart prostitute who takes her on a whirlwind adventure of passion, self-discovery and uninhibited sexual freedom.

programme.title: The Thorn of the Rose
programme.desc: Prosecuting Attorney David Lunga's success is overshadowed by the terrifying secrets of Rosa, a beautiful but mysterious woman with whom he falls in love. What mysteries does she hide? As the macabre facts unravel, David comes face to face with his own demons and is driven to prove his innocence, recover his reputation and, above all, clear his own conscience.

programme.title: BECOMING FREE
programme.desc: Becoming Free follows three young people who are returning home to Washington, DC, after spending years or decades behind bars.

programme.title: BLACK MUSEUM
programme.desc: Through interviews and observation, Director Oliver Hardt, who frequently addresses black history and culture with a strong emphasis on architecture, takes us through the remarkable physical spaces, the palpable engagement of museum visitors, and gives us insight into the challenges faced during the design process. The success of the project serves as a reminder that design and advanced storytelling can challenge the dominant political discourse and enable a diverse conversation.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: A couple, Nessa and Camden, continue their tradition of looking through each others phones once a month, but questionable text messages reveal the truth.

programme.title: A Legend in the Classroom: The Life Story of Ms. Yvonne Busch
programme.desc: Born in New Orleans in 1929 and raised in the historic Trem section of the city, Ms. Busch, who mastered several brass instruments and the woodwinds, became a touring professional by the age of 12. Later in life, she provided the foundation for scores of New Orleans finest musicians, who excelled in careers in jazz, R&B and gospel, by teaching them the rudiments of music.

programme.title: DREAMTOWN
programme.desc: DreamTown is a documentary about the precarious dream of a young Afro-Ecuadorian soccer player, Anibal Chala, as he strives to make it to the professional leagues, and eventually sees his dreams become reality.

programme.title: MANGO WARS
programme.desc: Mango Wars, a comedy set in present day Kingston, Jamaica, follows Mr. Brown who runs a mango jelly business with his pregnant wife, Mrs. Brown. Fed up with the theft of mangoes from his mango tree and the impending birth of his first child, he develops an elaborate plan to catch the thief red handed. But when all of the traps are set off by unlikely elements, Mr. Brown has to rethink what really matters.

programme.title: FLY BY LIGHT - REUNION
programme.desc: In 2015, the award-winning documentary Fly By Light followed youth from Washington, DC for three years as they went underwent a powerful peace education program that culminated in a 7-day overnight retreat in the mountains of West Virginia.

programme.title: SiDiKi
programme.desc: SiDiKi is an inspiring feature-length documentary about a man who--despite his physical limitations--found peace in dancing and guiding others toward the same healing. This film will change the way you view those labeled as disabled.

programme.title: MONA
programme.desc: In June 1973, a week before the Portuguese Prime Minister, Dr Ribeiro, is due to arrive in London for a state visit, protests all over the city are growing due to Portugal's harsh foreign policy in its colony of Mozambique.

programme.title: A THOUSAND MIDNIGHTS
programme.desc: This experimental documentary chronicles the contemporary manifestation of the economic and social histories of Black Americans who came to the north during the Great Migration in search of economic opportunities. The implications of their migration, and the lack of economic opportunity they encountered, has far reaching consequences for Black America today.

programme.title: While I Breathe I Hope
programme.desc: Through the experiences of South Carolina Politician Bakari Sellers, WHILE I BREATHE, I HOPE explores what it means to be young, Black, and Democrat in the American South. Executive Produced by Charlamagne Tha God.

programme.title: JMAXX AND THE UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
programme.desc: Jarrell Sullivan is a teenager with autism, who has a difficult time communicating with the world.

programme.title: DAVID'S REVEIRE
programme.desc: David is living his lifelong dream of becoming a star trumpet player when he is struck by epilepsy and the unpredictable seizures.

programme.title: Stiff
programme.desc: Tholang has been working as an undertaker in Soweto for as long as anyone can remember. He s great with death, but not particularly good with life. Things go awry when his niece arrives to apprentice under him and manages to lose the corpse of an important politician.

programme.title: THE BILL
programme.desc: Lena and ten other women could not be more excited to celebrate Barbie's 35th birthday. When an unexpectedly huge bill arrives, the happy birthday dissolves into drama.

programme.title: The Invisible Vegan
programme.desc: The Invisible Vegan explores the problem of unhealthy dietary patterns in the African-American community, foregrounding the health and wellness possibilities enabled by plant-based vegan diets and lifestyle choices. programme.title: The Unseen

programme.title: Ujamaa: A Co-op Culture Story
programme.desc: Explores how government programs in the 1950s and 60s attempted urban renewal but sadly resulted in poverty and health food inequity in the historic African American neighborhood of West Oakland, California. Rather than focusing on the problem, this documentary illustrates how worker-owned cooperatives are an empowering vehicle to build a resilient, healthy community.

programme.title: Cross Talk

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might..

programme.title: The Last Remaining Lifeboat
programme.desc: John White, from White Star Memories, takes us through the preservation of Nomadic’s last lifeboat. From her discovery in France to her Belfast restoration, White Star’s last remaining lifeboat carries on the legacy.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Marconi Room
programme.desc: Ken Marschall shows us the remarkable surprises they found inside Titanic’s Marconi room during James Cameron’s 2001 and 2005 dives to the wreck.

programme.title: The Californian Was Not the Mystery Ship
programme.desc: Molony states categorically and for all times that the Californian was not the mystery ship. No matter how you come down on this issue, this segment is a must watch! Molony gives a very detailed and fascinating argument on this historical dispute.

programme.title: Titanic Movie Memorabilia
programme.desc: One of the most desired categories of collectibles for Titanic enthusiasts is the growing movie memorabilia market – From the Nazi German Titanic movie in 1943 to James Cameron’s 1997 blockbuster - it’s all out there.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Turkish Bath
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Remembering Eva Hart
programme.desc: Charles Haas reflects on his friend, Titanic survivor Eva Hart, in an emotional never before told story of their last encounter and Eva’s surprising change of heart about recovering artifacts.

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero.

programme.title: Did First Officer Murdoch Shoot Himself?
programme.desc: Did First Officer Murdoch Shoot Himself? The Cameron movie suggests he did, but Parks Stephenson provides us with an eyewitness testimony that states another end for Officer Murdoch.

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: What did Marine Superintendent James McGiffin Know?
programme.desc: Why was White Star’s Marine Superintendent at Queenstown never called to give evidence to the British inquiry? After all, he was one of the last White Star representatives to step off Titanic before she sailed. Is this evidence that the inquiry was..

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: Titanic's Three Bladed Propeller
programme.desc: Based on a famous 1911 photograph of Olympic in dry dock, it has always been assumed that Titanic had an identical four-bladed center propeller. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside has uncovered a Harland & Wolff document that describes a three-bladed..

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: The Mirage Theory
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson gives us a clear and thorough explanation of the Mirage Theory. Does this theory really explain why Titanic hit the iceberg.

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: The Story Behind Titanic's Real Time Sinking
programme.desc: Tom Lynskey and Matt DeWinkeleer take us behind the scenes of their amazingly popular 2 hour 40 minute Titanic Sinks in REAL TIME. With over 17,670,154 views, it definitely captured the world’s attention.

programme.title: Please No Smoking But If You Must
programme.desc: In 1912 people knew that smoking was bad for your health. Titanic had designated nonsmoking areas around the ship but if you needed to light-up, the smoking lounges were waiting. Bill Sauder tells us there was more than just smoking going on inside.

programme.title: Mystery Stairs On Titanic
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host Bill Sauder tells us that like any great English house, Titanic had her quirks; including hallways that seem to go nowhere and staircases that served no purposes. What were they thinking? Sauder will explain.

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why..

programme.title: Titanic's Most Refined Features
programme.desc: Titanic Historian Bill Sauder continues his look at Titanic’s remarkable First Class Lounge. In this episode, Sauder reveals the architectural and decorative point of view and shows why the room was a showcase onboard the ship.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested..

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Money Troubles
programme.desc: People traveling in 1912 needed to take a lot of cash along on their journey. Unlike today, Europe and America were both cash societies and often that became a problem.

programme.title: Exploring Titanic
programme.desc: Called Titanic’s “Greatest Explorer,” PH Nargeolet takes us deep inside the wreck for a revealing look at Titanic’s interior.

programme.title: The Olympic Class Ships
programme.desc: Titanic Author, Mark Chirnside tells us that White Star spent more money on the three Olympic class ships then the entire value of their fleet in 1908. Were the Olympic Class ships the peak of shipbuilding in the early 1900’s.

programme.title: The Titanic Post Office
programme.desc: Titanic was carrying 3,423 sacks of mail! The mailbags contained over 7 million pieces of mail! The Sea Post Office on board the ship was big business for White Star. Craig Sopin gives us the inside story on the Royal Mail Steamer that failed to deliver..

programme.title: A Very Different World
programme.desc: Charles takes us back to 1912 and gives historic insight into how people received the Titanic news. He also makes the case that Titanic may have changed the world of journalism forever.

programme.title: The Identity Conspiracy
programme.desc: Was Titanic really swapped with Olympic? It’s a conspiracy theory that just will not die! Parks Stephenson may have the eyewitness accounts that will finally put all the conspiracy talk to rest.

programme.title: Trapped in a Tunnel
programme.desc: Senan Molony digs into the Titanic archives and finds a remarkable story of a greaser - trapped and then rescued from one of the most obscure and forgotten parts of the ship.

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 2
programme.desc: In the second part of this two-part series, Host Ken Marschall continues his remembrance of his friend Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: A Thief on Titanic
programme.desc: It’s always been a mystery why so many passengers on board Titanic were traveling incognito. Senan Molony uncovers the identity of one secret traveler, who ended up being a thief.

programme.title: Matching Shoes What Else Can That Be?
programme.desc: Ken Marschall, who’s been to the Titanic wreck six times, remembers standing at the door of Robert Ballard’s office and telling him, “I’ve found the bodies...

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism.

programme.title: How the Wreck Has Changed
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host and famed Titanic Explorer P.H. Nargeolet takes us back down to the wreck for a look at Titanic’s changing conditions and deterioration.

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and..

programme.title: Please No Smoking But If You Must
